intro: Aulomyrcia trifolia, commonly known as the three-leaved aulomyrcia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets arranged symmetrically. It produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Aulomyrcia trifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
